item.title: Aliens: Fireteam Elite 2 leaked by the ESRB
item.content:encoded:
Haven’t had one of these for a while, the ESRB (Entertainment Software Ratings Board) are usually on the ball when it comes to what they post and when, but something has slipped through, namely Aliens: Fireteam Elite 2.

Aliens: Fireteam Elite 2 has not been announced, there has been nothing from the publishers but perhaps that is because, according to the ESRB, Daybreak Games are publishing the game and not Focus Interactive.  Daybreak are more famous for its MMORPGs such as DC Universe Online, Everquest, and Dungeons & Dragons Online,  a multiplayer shooter is somewhat of a departure for them. Cold Iron Studios developed the first title – more on them later.

Last year, a design document for the game,  codenamed Project Macondo, leaked, and it said, “unlike Aliens Fireteam Elite, Project Macondo will feature fixed preset character archetypes and non-customisable characters.” It also stated that a new horde mode called Annihilation would be part of the game. It also suggested the game would be out near the end of 2025.

We can now add that information to a press release for investors made by Cold Iron Studios in February, in which they stated, “Daybreak is working closely with Cold Iron and on track to bring its new game to market later this year.” It appears that Cold Iron are developing the sequel it’s just the publisher that has changed.

According to the ESRB, Aliens: Fireteam Elite 2 will launch on Windows PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

We gave the original game 7/10 in our review, “Aliens: Fireteam Elite has a lack of mission variety, technical issues, bad matchmaking, and a repetitive structure. All of that said, it’s still a fun time. I’m off to play some more right now,” said Nic.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/10/06/aliens-fireteam-elite-2-leaked-by-the-esrb/
